revealed_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.
revealed_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.
revealed_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
revealed_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.
revealed_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
revealed_symptoms.shiny or waxy bump: It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.
revealed_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
revealed_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.

hidden_symptoms.ulceration: It’s like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.
hidden_symptoms.border irregularity: The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles.
hidden_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
hidden_symptoms.erythema: The skin around it looks red or puffy, like it’s irritated or reacting to something.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, I have this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels. It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in. It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before. It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin. It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away. I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks. And sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.

Thank you for providing that detailed information. Based on what you've described, this could be a sign of something serious. I'm concerned about the changes you've noticed in the spot on your skin, especially the fact that it's growing and bleeding. To get a better understanding, can you tell me about your family history of skin cancer? Has anyone in your family ever had skin cancer?
I don’t know anything about skin cancer in my family.
Thank you. Since you are unsure about your family history, let's talk about your exposure to the sun. Have you spent a lot of time in the sun, either for work or leisure? Did you use tanning beds?
I’ve spent a fair amount of time in the sun over the years. I enjoy being outside. I have never used tanning beds.
Okay, thanks. Now, can you tell me, how big is this spot? Roughly, would you say it’s the size of a pencil eraser, a dime, a quarter, or something else?
It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
Thank you. Has the spot changed shape, become more asymmetrical, or does it have an irregular border, like jagged edges? Also, have you had any bad sunburns in the past?
The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles.

Thank you. Given all this information, I am concerned about the possibility of skin cancer. Do you have any other moles or spots on your skin that look unusual or have changed recently? Also, can you tell me how long you have had this spot?
I have had this spot for a few months now.

doctor_history.content: Well, I have this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels. It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in. It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before. It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin. It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away. I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks. And sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
